text: are you good at controlling your
emotions do you find it easy to express
your thoughts to others these are core
aspects of emotional maturity defined by
the American Psychological Association
as having a high and appropriate level
of emotional control and expression
would you like to know if you have high
emotional maturity perhaps you have
recently seen the value of being
emotionally mature and you are now doing
your best to improve on yourself you
might also be looking to surround
yourself with people who have high
emotional maturity and want to know how
to identify them emotionally mature
people are self-aware flexible and
considerate of others do you know of
someone who may exhibit these traits can
you relate to these qualities let's talk
about six more signs of high emotional
maturity number one high empathy empathy
is key to emotional maturity if you are
an emotionally mature person then you
may be compassionate and do your best to
understand others point of view the
definition of empathy are you sensitive
to other people's feelings are you aware
of how your words and actions affect
others if so you display traits of
empathy according to psychotherapist and
licensed social worker Tanya Lester this
is a key characteristic of emotional
maturity she emphasized that emotional
maturity involves having empathy not
only for others but for yourself as well
this means that you also understand the
importance of learning how to be patient
and kind with yourself even upon
encountering failures and receiving
constructive criticism number two high
adaptability as an emotionally mature
person you may also find it relatively
easy to adjust to a wide variety of
people environments and
circumstances a study published in the
Indian Journal of Applied research
reported that adjustment was related to
emotional maturity students who were
more emotionally mature were also able
to adjust to the demands of college life
this applies that another aspect of high
emotional maturity is the ability to
adjust to life changes and different
situations hence if you are emotionally
mature then you may also be highly
adaptable number three conflict and
anger management an emotionally mature
person is patient in dealing with
different types of people and
situations psychologist and behavioral
expert Dr Lou PR marera and his
colleague Dr Rob Pascal explained that
people with high emotional maturity
don't impulsively take out their
frustrations on others when they don't
get their way the people around them
know that they would never intentionally
cause them physical or emotional harm it
is natural to feel angry every now and
then maturity lies in how you handle
these feelings if you are able to handle
these problems with a level head then
you may have high emotions
maturity number four communication
skills when you have problems with
schoolmates or workmates do you discuss
these calmly and politely with the
people involved if so you have good
communication skills according to Dr
Prima Vera and Dr Pascal this is a
marker of high emotional maturity they
wrote that communicating well is part of
proper conflict resolution this and
tales working through your issues with
the people involved in them instead of
allowing these to
escalate if you are emotionally mature
you also stay away from using insults
abusive language and a harsh or
condescending tone you want to make sure
that whoever you're speaking to doesn't
feel
attacked you also do your best to face
your problems with others instead of
sweeping them under a rug you are aware
that avoid the person or the issue will
only allow negative feelings to build up
inside you you can recognize when it is
time to confront someone and you act
upon it with caution and
kindness number five
accountability a person with high
emotional maturity takes full
responsibility for themselves and their
actions a study published in the
peer-reviewed academic Journal violence
and victims reported that people who are
emot Al immature may deny that they have
said or done anything hurtful in
contrast to this if you have high
emotional maturity then you do not
simply toss blame around whenever things
go AR you don't immediately get
defensive when someone brings up your
part in a conflict nor do you
automatically deny that you've done
something wrong without hearing the
other person out instead you listen to
the other person's point of view you
sincerely reflect and then acknowledge
when you've made a mistake you also
apologize for your wrongdoings and make
up for them as needed number six
honesty are you honest with the people
around you do you speak up and tell the
truth even when it's difficult according
to the afam mentioned psychotherapist
Tanya Lester to be emotionally mature is
to tell the truth because you believe
it's the right thing to do even when you
know that others might
disagree this can be as simple as being
honest with a friend when they ask for
your opinion even when you know the
truth will be hard for them to hear
being honest in a kind empathetic and
respectful way takes great emotional
maturity emotional maturity also
involves being honest with yourself and
your own feelings a practice that gives
you peace of mind this also allows you
to be more vulnerable in important close
relationships you are able to show
trusted loved ones your true self and
clearly express your feelings and needs
this leads to to more meaningful
relationships that are grounded in
trust are you able to show trusted loved
ones your true self and clearly express
your feelings and needs can you be
vulnerable in close relationships
emotional maturity involves being honest
with yourself and your own feelings a
practice that can give you more peace of
mind and lead to more meaningful
relationships that are grounded in
trust do you relate to these
signs if you don't quite see see
yourself in these signs just yet just
remember that the road to becoming more
emotionally mature is a journey and
learning more about what it entails is
an important step in the right direction
remember that being kind and patient
with yourself is part of growing and
learning how to be a healthier happier
version of yourself
[Music]
